name: David Heath
content: David Heath daheath@illinois.edu Siebel Center for Computer Science, Room 4322 About Me I am a cryptographer and an assistant professor at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. My research focuses on Secure Multiparty Computation (MPC), Zero Knowledge proofs, and Oblivious Data Structures. I am broadly interested in algorithmic techniques for reducing the cost of powerful cryptographic methods. To learn more about my research, you can peruse my work below or have a look at my CV.
